title: two letters that ruin any game. "ez"
body: > Anyone else experiencing this lack of sportsmanship every 3 games? people enjoy you typing a word back and reply salt, cry, etc So dont say a word and leave your /all chat off. There is no mutual fun to be had there.

replies.body: {{item:3070}} {{champion:81}}

Apparently as a support, I'm not allowed to talk to you if you pick that champ. Which is weird, because I'd rather see Ez than Teemo.
"gj ez."

Trash talking is only fun when it's between equals. Trash talking your 0-5 lane opponent is neither fun or honorable. To be honest I'd rather mock myself for a mistake ("The greed is real") or laughing because I survived something I shouldn't have ("15 health OP") than insulting an opponent.

If everyone was honorable in victory then there would be no point in an honor system. Gloating is a legitimate part of any competition. There is literally a Darius skin that does nothing but taunt and gloat. I'm not going to tell you to "stop being sensitive" because "ez" is a jerk move. But this is a natural part of competition. No one is required to be sportsman like to you. If they are, honor them, because they have been exceptionally honorable.

> [{quoted}](name=SephAgro,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-06T15:16:17.704+0000)
>
> If everyone was honorable in victory then there would be no point in an honor system. Gloating is a legitimate part of any competition. There is literally a Darius skin that does nothing but taunt and gloat. I'm not going to tell you to "stop being sensitive" because "ez" is a jerk move. But this is a natural part of competition. No one is required to be sportsman like to you. If they are, honor them, because they have been exceptionally honorable.

Being a jerk should never be seen as acceptible... it's one thing to have clever trashtalking that's good natured between enemies. I've had games like that. There was one game where I was playing as Zyra against Sona, and I kept demolishing her and at one point I made the comment 'my favourite part about facing Sona is that she just can't say no'. The person playing Sona laughed and we had some banter throughout the game. That was the right type of 'trashtalk' because it was funny and it was in good nature...

saying 'gg ez' has no creativity, no humour, and is clearly in bad nature. That's the WRONG type of trashtalking. And it should not be encouraged. But if you want to banter with your opponents to get everyone into the game... then that's fine. Just at least put a BIT of thought into it and make it not directly insulting.

The only time I bother with trash talk is to create an advantage. When I want to put someone on tilt, and something has shown me it's a potential option. "good natured banter" is not trash talk. There's also no sense in trash talking an already defeated opponent that you're unlikely to see again. It serves absolutely no purpose, and is typically the behavior of middling skill level players.

> [{quoted}](name=Digitality,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-03-06T20:21:57.344+0000)
>
> The only time I bother with trash talk is to create an advantage. When I want to put someone on tilt, and something has shown me it's a potential option. "good natured banter" is not trash talk. There's also no sense in trash talking an already defeated opponent that you're unlikely to see again. It serves absolutely no purpose, and is typically the behavior of middling skill level players.

which is why I put quotes around trash talk. That's the only type of discourse that should be happening, really. If you're trying to belittle someone, then you deserve to be banned regardless of your reasoning for doing it.

So I should never attack weak mental composure of an opponent if I believe it's possible to do so?

I approach the game to win. I will use all possible advantages within the rules to do so.

On the opposite side of this same coin, I do what I can to support the morale of my own team and try to curb any in-fighting. I try to keep my allies from going on tilt and throwing.

When you're fighting aliens and defending the existence of human race, then use any advantage you can. But this is just a game, and that victory isn't worth insulting other players that are just regular people like you.

> [{quoted}](name=Digitality,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-07T12:45:06.919+0000)
>
> So I should never attack weak mental composure of an opponent if I believe it's possible to do so?
> 
> I approach the game to win. I will use all possible advantages within the rules to do so.
> 
> On the opposite side of this same coin, I do what I can to support the morale of my own team and try to curb any in-fighting. I try to keep my allies from going on tilt and throwing.

So the game is more important to you than the people playing it? I don't think there's much for us to say then.
His team is important to him, obviously. The enemy just has to turn of all chat. It's not exactly a requirement

> [{quoted}](name=FlackGacket,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=0001000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2015-03-07T21:54:53.718+0000)
>
> His team is important to him, obviously. The enemy just has to turn of all chat. It's not exactly a requirement

no, he's just stated they aren't. He'll encourage them SO HE CAN WIN. Not because they matter. People have no meaning to him except in how he can use them. That's the type of mindset he has, and that's why there's not much to say to him.

People matter to me in-so-far as the context of my association with them. I'm a pragmatist and I have no shame in that.

I'm not seeing the problem. My team by association with my desire to win only benefits from that relationship. Whether or not I like them or care about them as individuals is entirely irrelevant within the context of playing this game.

> [{quoted}](name=Digitality,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=000100000000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-24T03:25:12.429+0000)
>
> People matter to me in-so-far as the context of my association with them. I'm a pragmatist and I have no shame in that.
> 
> I'm not seeing the problem. My team by association with my desire to win only benefits from that relationship. Whether or not I like them or care about them as individuals is entirely irrelevant within the context of playing this game.

That's not pragmatism... you're just using pragmatism to justify a purely self-centered attitude. Being a pragmatist doesn't mean you have to see everyone purely as tools.

Don't get me wrong, I don't necessarily have any right to judge you for SEEING things that way. You have a right to be selfish, whatever your reasoning... but don't try to justify it, just accept that you're a purely self-centered individual and be proud of it. Afterall, it is who you are.

I'm self-serving, but not entirely. Most people are self-serving to some degree. I just don't bother with the moral quandaries in actually admitting it to myself. In practice it allows me to be a better person. Or at least an honest one.

What  do you believe applied pragmatism is if not setting aside idealism and focusing on the most practical ways to achieve a goal?

> [{quoted}](name=Digitality,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=00010000000000000000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-24T04:54:12.742+0000)
>
> I'm self-serving, but not entirely. Most people are self-serving to some degree. I just don't bother with the moral quandaries in actually admitting it to myself. In practice it allows me to be a better person. Or at least an honest one.
> 
> What  do you believe applied pragmatism is if not setting aside idealism and focusing on the most practical ways to achieve a goal?

I think you need to do your research. I'm not going to educate you on the nuances of the philosophical path you claim to have chosen simply to prove a point. THIS is being pragmatic. The gain of spending time on that would be far too small to outweigh the potential value that time could generate for me elsewhere. Educate yourself, because trust me - what you claim to be 'pragmatism' is little more than an excuse to be egocentric to a fault.

I'm not talking about philosophical pragmatism here. Though I do think it's more appropriate than you believe it to be.

I think you conflate methodology with motivation and personality too much so as to make them inseparable.

Indifference is not the same thing as being egocentric. I'm very much aware of the effects my actions and behavior potentially have on other people. If I wasn't understanding of other people's feelings I'd be unable to even try manipulating results on the levels that I want to. I just don't care about it unless I have a reason to care about them. Random stranger on the internet is pretty low on that bar for me. Yet we have a shared goal (victory for our team, and defeat for the enemy team) within the context of the game and I do care about that. So because this isn't a single player game I must rely on my team to fulfill their roles, and I will behave in a manner conducive to that.

Would some deeper moral motivation be more correct somehow?

Its mostly ppl trying hard to be funny.
its's not.

If the choice were between having all chat on, and uninstalling League, I would uninstall League in a heartbeat. Why would you invite even more 12 year olds to speak? I'm already having to babysit my team mates and teach them basic tenets of civilization in half of all the games I play, I certainly do not want the other five parent-less little animals babbling at me while I try to enjoy a game. There are so many LoL players' parents who owe me money for unpaid daycare that it's not even funny, and I've barely started playing this game.

> [{quoted}](name=3xRail,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=0020,timestamp=2015-03-07T09:40:43.418+0000)
>
> If the choice were between having all chat on, and uninstalling League, I would uninstall League in a heartbeat. Why would you invite even more 12 year olds to speak? I'm already having to babysit my team mates and teach them basic tenets of civilization in half of all the games I play, I certainly do not want the other five parent-less little animals babbling at me while I try to enjoy a game. There are so many LoL players' parents who owe me money for unpaid daycare that it's not even funny, and I've barely started playing this game.

I cannot possibly upvote this enough.

I hate {{champion:81}} too.

Jokes aside, ye it really shows how bad the ppl telling this are.

Remember people, the way to be an Honorable Opponent is to be "humble in victory or graceful in defeat."
As someone who does a *lot* of honoring, I see it as a real shame that those two letters can make everyone think a lot less of you.
I dont think I've EVER seen humble victories in LoL.
I see people type it in games that don't even have an Ezreal.
Apparently they had a game earlier with an Ezreal who was just THAT GOOD.

/facepalm

it's one thing having some idiot rage at his own team but you'd have to be fragile as hell to feel like a game was ruined because someone said "ez".

lay off the god damn estrogen, kids, 
holy fuck.

Someone saying 'ez' won't ruin my game but it does make me hate the disrespectful little fuck. Saying 'ez' is a sign of disrespect and a pathetic thing to do. Won't ruin my matches but it shouldn't be said in the first place.

> [{quoted}](name=AlphaKiloGaming,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=00170000,timestamp=2015-03-07T05:15:58.056+0000)
>
> Someone saying 'ez' won't ruin my game but it does make me hate the disrespectful little fuck. Saying 'ez' is a sign of disrespect and a pathetic thing to do. Won't ruin my matches but it shouldn't be said in the first place.

get over it, geek, this isn't some idiotic fairy world where everything is rainbows and unicorns.  someone saying "ez" should be the least of your problems... no, it shouldn't be a problem at all considering how ridiculously mild it is yet for some reason these type of non-issues still rile up this pathetic generation of overly-sensitive liberals.

Geek and liberal used as insults. I need no further information to know the kind of person you are. 

I never said 'ez' was a problem. I simply said I hate people that say it. Someone says 'ez' and I think 'disrespectful piece of shit' then put him on ignore and go on with the rest of my day. I was raised well enough to respect others. It's a shame you and other people were less fortunate.

> [{quoted}](name=AlphaKiloGaming,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=0017000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-07T05:54:20.546+0000)
>
> Geek and liberal used as insults. I need no further information to know the kind of person you are. 
> 
> I never said 'ez' was a problem. I simply said I hate people that say it. Someone says 'ez' and I think 'disrespectful piece of shit' then put him on ignore and go on with the rest of my day. I was raised well enough to respect others. It's a shame you and other people were less fortunate.

wow, hatred simply because someone said "ez"?  you sure sound like an emotional and intolerant douchebag who doesn't deserve a shred of respect.
Yes, I hate people that are disrespectful just because they want to be assholes. Call me what you will. Doesn't bother me in the slightest.

> [{quoted}](name=AlphaKiloGaming,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=001700000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-07T07:37:13.411+0000)
>
> Yes, I hate people that are disrespectful just because they want to be assholes. 

It's hard to believe that all it takes to be a disrespectful asshole is to be honest and say "ez".  tbh, "ez" is one of the mildest ways of telling someone that they need to step up their game, not to mention they may not even be saying it to you considering that there are 4 other people on your team.

> Call me what you will. Doesn't bother me in the slightest.

don't lie to me, of course it bothers you.  I mean seriously, it bothers you when someone says "ez", ROFL!  no wonder why you hate honesty so much, you're probably a compulsive liar.

"It's hard to believe that all it takes to be a disrespectful asshole is to be honest and say "ez". tbh, "ez" is one of the mildest ways of telling someone that they need to step up their game, not to mention they may not even be saying it to you considering that there are 4 other people on your team."

They are saying it with the sole intent to be disrespectful. They are saying it to rub the victory in the face of the opponent. They are being a shitty winner and a disrespectful asshole.

"don't lie to me, of course it bothers you. I mean seriously, it bothers you when someone says "ez", ROFL! no wonder why you hate honesty so much, you're probably a compulsive liar."

I have no reason to lie to an anonymous nobody on the internet. Again, call me whatever you want. It does not bother me. 

The fact that all you can do is resort to insults about myself means you know you have no angle in this argument and that gives me endless satisfaction. Feel free to keep doing this little back and forth. I enjoy watching you lose. It's so 'ez'.

> [{quoted}](name=AlphaKiloGaming,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=00170000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-07T08:26:21.742+0000)
>
> I have no reason to lie to an anonymous nobody on the internet. Again, call me whatever you want. It does not bother me. 

if you have no reason to lie to an "anonymous nobody on the internet" then you should have no reason to get all emotional because of an anonymous nobody who said "ez".
 
>  I enjoy watching you lose. It's so 'ez'.

a liar and a hypocrite

damn

I don't get emotional. I think to myself that he/she is a disrespectful ass and mute them. No emotion involved what so ever.

That is not hypocritical nor am I a liar. You have given me ample reasons to have no respect for you so being sarcastic and disrespectful is the appropriate response. These people are disrespectful for no reason other than to be assholes. I am being disrespectful to make a point but by all means continue. I will indulge you for a few more minutes.

> [{quoted}](name=AlphaKiloGaming,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=0017000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-07T08:35:58.192+0000)
>
> I don't get emotional.

you say this thing but everything else you write completely contradicts it.
the lying, it just won't stop!

> That is not hypocritical 

yes it is

>or am I a liar. 

liar

>You have given me ample reasons to have no respect for you so being sarcastic and disrespectful is the appropriate response.

only people who matter respect me.

> These people are disrespectful for no reason other than to be assholes. 

you're making an assumption, perhaps he just wanted to be honest.

> I am being disrespectful to make a point but by all means continue. 

sorry, I can't take your poor attempt to be disrespectful seriously when you're clearly getting raped beyond belief.

Let's just skip the first three because I have already covered that in prior posts.

I have no respect for you because you default to insulting me in every comment you post simply because I disagree. That is a valid reason to have no respect for someone.

I am assuming nothing. I am coming to a conclusion based on personal observations. 

I am curious as to whether or not you know what the word 'raped' means as it has no correlation to this conversation. 

For such a tolerant person you sure do get awful hostile toward differing opinions. Maybe you don't know what tolerant means either. Should I Google it for you?

> [{quoted}](name=AlphaKiloGaming,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=001700000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-07T08:55:17.924+0000)
>
> Let's just skip the first three because I have already covered that in prior posts.

good idea, a liar is never going to tell the truth about those anyways.

> I am assuming nothing. I am coming to a conclusion based on personal observations. 

still an assumption.

> I am curious as to whether or not you know what the word 'raped' means 

I am aware.

> For such a tolerant person you sure do get awful hostile toward differing opinions. Maybe you don't know what tolerant means either. Should I Google it for you?

oh I'm definitely not a tolerant person, however, I am not a filthy emotional liberal who flips out just because someone said "ez" nor am I intolerant towards people who are honest about facts.
Surakai, do you even know what a liberal is and the foundation for the ideology?

Learn the meaning of words before attempting to argue them. It is not an assumption if the reason they are doing it is evident.

Good. At least you can acknowledge the fact that you are talking about things completely unrelated to the conversation at hand.

Once again... no emotion is involved. Please learn to comprehend the words you are reading.

You try to call me intolerant as an insult and then admit to being intolerant yourself? You don't get enough satisfaction from insulting me so you have to insult yourself? You might want to seek some professional help as that is very dangerous to your, questionable, mental health.

Again, what is with using liberal as an insult? 

Learn what a fact is then try again. 'Maybe' is not a term used to state a fact. It is an assumption on your part.

Before replying please be sure to Google each word you use. I won't bother reading it but someone else might and it would be a courtesy to them. You are going to blindly argue your side regardless of evidence or common sense so there is no point continuing this exchange. Have a good night... or don't. Frankly I don't care either way.
Whats worse is when its a 4v5 game that takes 60+ minutes for them to sloppily finish and push your base.

I just report for negative attitude and move on.

During the game is different from the end of the game. during the game go ahead and trash talk as long as you do so without being Racist/sexist/homophobic. At the end of the game however there is no psychological gain to be had you are just being a douch.

I have to agree with the OP, strongly. There is nothing positive that "ez" adds to the community. Belittling an opponent is against the Summoner's Code, that we ALL agree to abide by for a civil and constructive environment. "6 Show Humility in Victory, and Grace in Defeat" most glaringly is violated.
I ABSOLUTELY encourage aggressive gameplay. When someone is raging at being ganked my team gets instructed to GANK HIM HARD to try to get him to quit. Friendly discussion between opponents is also a welcome addition to any game I play. I genuinely enjoy talking to people that aren't complete, blatant douchebags.
I'm still not sure why allchat is even a thing.  It's not necessary or useful for anything constructive.  Why do we have an option to turn it off, when really, it just shouldn't exist?

i dont understand why people dont like saying GG EZ.

all they are doing is thanking ezreal for a great game
So if I am winning my lane because my opponent made some outright terrible decisions, I can't say "outplayed"?
No. The difference between outplay and beating your opponent because of terrible decisions is huge.

> [{quoted}](name=Jelly Mac,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=9jWhE0bi,comment-id=001e,timestamp=2015-03-07T04:48:56.347+0000)
>
> So if I am winning my lane because my opponent made some outright terrible decisions, I can't say "outplayed"?

Are you adding something positive to the community? If he dies because of his terrible decisions he most likely knows it. You are most likely never going to see this player again, why not add something positive? Can give him some advice after the match on how to improve his game.

Well because when I lose lane/get afk's/intentional feeders people always treat me poorly. Spamming laugh, "GG REKT/EZ" and the like. For every person that offers me advice when I lose lane or honors me for not surrendering in 4v5, there are 10 that say "Lol your trash" or "QQ some more noob"
but{{champion:81}}
